personas.persona_name: North America Enterprise Marketplaces - Revenue Leaders
personas.company_type: Large multi‑sided platforms (commerce, delivery, gig economy) that onboard sellers, manage payouts, and require global compliance and complex revenue-split logic.
personas.description: Large marketplace platforms with multi‑region seller networks and significant transaction volume. 100-300 payments and platform staff. $500K-$3M annual contracts with 6-9 month sales cycles involving 6-10 stakeholders (CRO, CFO, Head of Risk, VP Payments, Legal, Procurement, Platform/Product). Decisions require security/KYC/KYB validation, tax and payout capabilities, and exec sponsorship. Strong fit for Connect, Treasury, Radar, Identity, Payouts and Professional Services; best engaged through executive briefings, technical workshops and sandbox pilots that validate multi‑party flows.

personas.persona_name: United States Mid-Market E-commerce - Commerce Leaders
personas.company_type: Mid-market online and omnichannel retailers seeking to optimize conversion, checkout experience, and unify online/in-store payments across channels.
personas.description: Growing e‑commerce brands and omnichannel retailers focused on conversion and localization. 20-100 commerce, product and payments staff. $50K-$350K annual spend with 3-6 month procurement cycles involving 3-5 stakeholders (CMO, VP Digital Commerce, Head of Payments, Finance, IT). Evaluation centers on checkout UX, fraud reduction, tax handling and quick time-to-live. Strong fit for Checkout, Radar, Billing, Tax, Terminal and Payment Links; engage via A/B test results, conversion uplift case studies and streamlined integration playbooks.

personas.persona_name: California Large B2B SaaS - Finance & Ops Leaders
personas.company_type: Established SaaS vendors with subscription and usage billing needs, complex revenue recognition, and global customer bases looking to consolidate payments and billing with finance ops.
personas.description: Mid-to-large SaaS companies with subscription and usage-based monetization and global customers. 20-100 sales, billing and finance ops staff. $100K-$750K annual contracts with 4-8 month sales cycles involving 4-7 stakeholders (CFO, VP Revenue Operations, Head of Billing, Legal, Sales Leadership, Finance). Procurement emphasizes RevRec compliance, invoicing flexibility, and integration with ERP/finance tools. Strategic fit for Billing, Invoicing, Sigma, Tax, Financial Connections and Professional Services; best engaged through ROI modeling, technical integration workshops and finance‑led pilots.

personas.persona_name: United Kingdom Small Marketplaces - Founders & Product
personas.company_type: Early growth UK platforms and two‑sided marketplaces (niche verticals, creator platforms, B2C marketplaces) with founder-led product decision-making and lean operations.
personas.description: Small UK marketplaces with founder/product-led buying and a focus on fast time-to-market. 5-30 product and engineering staff. £15K-£75K annual spend with 1-3 month buying cycles involving 2-4 stakeholders (Founder/CEO, CTO, Head of Product, Finance). Decision-making prioritizes quick integration, KYC basics, and predictable fees. Strong fit for Connect, Payment Links, Identity, Radar and Checkout; engage via developer docs, quick-start templates, and frictionless self-serve pilots with local case studies.

personas.company_type: Restaurant and hospitality groups in Australia & New Zealand running multiple locations requiring unified online/offline payments, POS integration and simplified reconciliation.
personas.description: Multi-location restaurant and hospitality operators seeking to unify online and in‑store payments and simplify reconciliation. 20-150 store and operations staff. $25K-$200K annual platform spend with 2-6 month procurement cycles involving 3-6 stakeholders (COO, Head of Stores, Finance Director, Head of IT, Procurement). Buying emphasizes PCI‑compliant hardware, low‑friction refunds, and terminal + online reconciliation. Strong fit for Terminal, Payments, Radar, Payouts and Terminal integrations; engage via regional pilots, partner POS integrations, hardware demos and localized support.

result.generation_reasoning: I created five buyer company archetypes that map Stripe's broad product catalog to distinct market segments with clear needs (Marketplaces, E‑commerce, B2B SaaS, Founder-led marketplaces, Hospitality). I balanced tiers across opportunity: two tier_1 (high fit, larger deal sizes and accessible enterprise/mid‑market buyers), two tier_2 (solid fit with moderate complexity), and one tier_3 (opportunistic regional segment). Each persona is differentiated by at least two dimensions (industry, geography, company size, or primary function). Titles follow the provided master patterns and include all title variations and seniority ordering. Descriptions include the required quantitative metrics (team size, deal size, sales cycle, stakeholder count) and a concise decision process, strategic product fit, and recommended engagement approach for Stripe's products.
